Package net.explorviz.shared.querying

Class Query<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.explorviz.shared.querying.Query<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the resulting objects
    public class Query<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Classes that implement the Queryable interface can answer a set of entities corresponding to query. Such a a query defines
    • if and how the resulting data should be paginated
    • if and by which attributes the resulting data should be filtered

    Using this querying mechanic instead of fetching the entirety of the data and processing the results afterwards is in general more efficient.

    • Method Detail

      • getPageSize

        public int getPageSize()
        Size of each page. If no pagination is wanted, this method returns -1.
        Returns:
        the requested size of a page or -1, if no pagination is intended.

      • getPageNumber

        public int getPageNumber()
        Number of requested the page. If no pagination is wanted, this method returns -1.
        Returns:
        the index of the page to return or -1, if no pagination is intended.

      • getFilters

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getFilters()
        Map that specifies how results should be filtered. Each entry of the map consists of the name of the attribute to filter by and the value to filter for. If no filtering should be performed, this map is empty.

        If more than one value is specified for a key, resulting objects should satisfy both (i.e. conjunction, not disjunction)

        Returns:
        a map specifying if and how to filter.

      • doPaginate

        public boolean doPaginate()
        Checks whether the result should be paginated.
        Returns:
        True iff the result must be paginated. Returns false if either getPageNumber() returns a number smaller than 0 or getPageSize() returns a number equal or smaller to 0.

      • doFilter

        public boolean doFilter()
        Checks whether the query should be filtered.
        Returns:
        True iff the attributes to filter by are empty.

      • fromParameterMap

        public static <T> Query<T> fromParameterMap​(javax.ws.rs.core.MultivaluedMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> paramters)
        Returns a Query based on the raw query parameters of a HTTP request. The parameters can be obtain by ContainerRequestContext.getUriInfo() and UriInfo.getQueryParameters(boolean)
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the entity this query is for
        Parameters:
        paramters - the raw HTTP query parameters
        Returns:
        a query object corresponding to the given parameters
